Reviews.Title: “The Hotel keeps getting better!”
Reviews.Author: BrazilAca
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Novotel Mexico. This is a very nice hotel, with a great cost benefit. The rooms are very nice the staff is friendly and helpful. The impression I had was that the Novotel improved since Jun/10 when I was here for the first time. Just be aware that Santa Fe is not the best location in Mexico DF if your office is not in this neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Do not bring a car.”
Reviews.Author: og84
Reviews.Content: Under no circumstances arrive with your car or a rental car....the motor lobby is extremely small and is shared among several tenants, so even getting into the motor lobby is tough. In the afternoon and evening, they allow cars to park on the curbs and any available space, so its difficult to even get to the valet service. Its difficult to see the one and only entrance when arriving due to the neighboring office building, which blocks a view of the ingress situation. Otherwise, the service is good, they have free Internet service which works reasonably well and the rooms are clean and neat with a lot of workspace. The hotel is close to the Bancomer Expo Center, but despite the proximity, it is a difficult walk due to the layout of Santa Fe. It is difficult to see the hotel from a distance due to all the new office towers that have been constructed around it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, disappointing restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Nic659
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, I love the room and the bed is great. They also have a good gym. However, I echo the negative reviews of the restaurant. The breakfast selection is very good, but everything was cold every day. Cold eggs, sausage, bacon, etc. has never been a favorite of mine. And the service at the restaurant matches the food, cold and very impersonal. Room service was good and friendly but the food varied between fabulous and terrible. Got a ciabatta sandwich made with totally stale bread, and the advertised fries turned out to be lettuce. Dissapointing, and spoiled an otherwise good experience.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, bad food”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a good stay, but I am disapointed in the food served. Once I ordered fish which was very smelly and clearly not fresh and the day before all the food at the buffet looked really dried up (dry cucumber, anyone?). Then I ordered a club sandwich with chips... the sandwich was more or less OK, but the chips were just bad ; like potato strips soaked in fat, not "French Fries"... The flyer in the room said breakfast served on weekdays at 6:00 and on sunday at 6:30 . On sunday when I wanted to take breakfast at 6:30, the flatscreen in the lobby tickertaped that breakfast was served at 7:00.... overall breakfast was OK.A nice hotel in a good location, but kitchen quality need improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: BrazilAca
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! Great staff and fine service! Fine rooms, poor wi-fi, however a good hotel all over! Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Do not go here (unless you like food poisoning)”
Reviews.Author: Fischgericht
Reviews.Content: I usually are very happy with Novotel. However, the Novotel Santa Fe has some serious management issues. I booked for 3 nights for a business trip together with a colleage. The location itself is nice, besides that there is a really next construction site next to the hotel (another hotel being build) - this results in some outside areas of the hotel to be closed, and lots of noise. As the room windows are good, that's not a big problem though. The problems however started when we wanted to eat. In the hotel restaurant at the first evening I ordered chicken cordon bleu. The chicken I was served had been fried several ours ago, and even already got cut in the middle at the point. They just warmed it up. The cheese therefore had already been gone hard instead of being melted, color was orange, the meat itself was extremely dried out. I could not finish this. I complained to the waitress, who also was shocked about the dish. I then was served dessert, and this was REALLY bad. I ordered flan, some kind of creme caramel - it involves raw egg, so this has to be really fresh. But it also had gone bad already. I just took one bite, noting immediately that the egg had gone bad - still I had to stay quite a lot of time on the restroom that night. The next morning the breakfast again was really bad - the scrambled eggs again appeared to be several hours old etc. In addition to that, the room cleaning hasn't been really good - when we arrived, the windows were really dirty. In the morning at 8am, someone was waking up everyone on the floor by knocking on each door asking if we had some clothes that need to be cleaned - terrible idea. It took until 4pm until room cleaning showed up. While I had booked for 3 nights, at this point I decided I'm not getting myself food poisened another time, and booked another nearby hotel. We went to the front desk to tell that we were checking out, telling them in detail on what had happened to us. We didn't get an excuse, instead we were told we could not check out because we had booked for 3 nights. I demanded to speak to the manager. I was told excuses that the manager would not be in the house, then after half an hour someone turned up telling us he is the assistance to the manager (which was a lie) and basically they did everything to make sure we would not speak to the manager. I had to threaten them to charge back the full amount from my credit card until after an hour they finally called for the real manager. He did excuse a lot, promised to investigate, and made sure we were able to check out paying only for the single night we had stayed. All in all this has been the most unpleasant stay at a hotel ever for me. This hotel needs to get a audit from Novotel urgently. While the hotel would be nice, at it's current state I can not at all recommend going there.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality / price ratio”
Reviews.Author: fredtravel99
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week in October. I was skeptic because of the name but I could say that I was impressed. The quality is really good for the price (clean room and large). Confortable bed and one good thing is that air conditioning works very well. Good breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient if you are doing business in Santa Fe, meets a business traveler's needs”
Reviews.Author: PurpleScout
Reviews.Content: This is a standard business hotel in a part of the city that is mostly visited by business travelers. My company's offices are nearby, and it was convenient to stay at the Novotel. It was clean, comfortable, and provided all the services and amenities I needed. I got very sick during my stay, and the hotel called an English-speaking doctor. He turned out to be the doctor for KLM airlines. A couple shots in the hind quarter, and I was back on my feet. Thankfully, a mild case of Montezuma's revenge. The hotel allowed me to pay the doctor by adding his bill to my hotel charges (for a small service fee). The hotel arranged a cart to pick me up at the airport, and that went very smoothly. They also arranged a car and driver to take me out to the pyramids in the morning on the day I was departing, and then to drop me at the airport. They got a much better deal than I was able to find on-line, and I was very happy with the driver (a young man who grew up in California and spoke perfect English).

Reviews.Title: “OK but only just 4*”
Reviews.Author: Farnham_Flyer
Reviews.Content: This is really just a standard business hotel. Room was modern, comfortable and clean. Had potable water unlike some Mexico DF hotels... You would only want to stay here if on business in the Santa Fe district as it is a good 1-2 hours out of the centre. I found the front desk service to be excellent, but restaurant and bar staff very inattentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldMate1
Reviews.Content: I was actually surprised by the number of 5-star reviews here on TripAdvisor, but it turned out they were 100% correct. I stayed 3 nights in November. The place is new, rooms are clean, functional and spacious. Room service is great - good food, very cheap. Breakfast buffet is above average. Gym is OK (the pool is closed in winter). Last - the value for money is simply great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and Nice City!”
Reviews.Author: German3707
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for attending some business. The area looks so fashion and the buildings around the hotel (including this) are modern and first world. I like the way the clerk welcomed me, rooms are O.K. and I could sleep as baby in that bed. I thought the hotel was far away from everywhere, but the concierge helped me to organize a trip to Teotihuacan. It took just 20 minutes to get from the hotel to the agency where all tourists gather for the same tour. Then came the beauty, this pyramids are wonderful and the wheather helped to enjoy this trip. I really has a good experience in Novotel Santa Fe,it 's located in the corporate area, staff help others, nice beds and I know that ACCOR around the world offers this standard service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Price in the area”
Reviews.Author: USATraveler40
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Santa Fe tend to be expensive and the rack rate for the Novotel Santa Fe is no exception. However, if you visit the website there is a no cancellation & no changes deal, which is debited from your credit card at the time of booking, I saved 54 dollars and I booked my room with the best price in the area. Next morning of checking in my surprise was that Novotel offers a free shuttle to the Convention Centre anytime. The hotel is very comfortable indeed. Rooms are nicely furnished and well thought out, an electronic safe big enough to house a laptop, coffee/tea making facilities, minibar, TV, desk and a sofa. The bed was comfortable and I particularly liked the volcano view. The bathroom was also nice; with a bathtub (I stayed few weeks ago in other hotel in Santa Fe that they just have the walk-in shower), there is also a hairdryer, tissues etc. Obviously this is a business hotel but I wish this hotel would consider leisure travelers on a budget and make their Internet facilities more affordable! Having said that though, there are 2 PCs in the business area just off the lobby where you can access the Internet free of charge and they both have a printer attached, also free to use.

Reviews.Title: “A So-so experience”
Reviews.Author: AlinaNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for work in Nov 2005. Rooms were ok. The bed is too low, the runnig joke was that it was one of those IKEA beds. But everything else ok. Phone calls were too expensive! I was advised that one minute call to Canada will be $5 (US). I used my cell phone, even with roaming charges it came to be $3 Canadian. Internet access I believe was $15/day - pretty pricey if you ask me. The so-called business center was a joke. So was the gym/pool area. The pool was kind of cute, but it was outside and it was too cold to use. Breakfast was $15 US!! For not too many options! - that's an outrage, if you ask me! The hotel has poor organization. When we were checking out the billing was totally screwed up, the charges were all over the place and most of it was in Spanish. It was obvious this hotel was geared towards business people from all over the world, and the fact that billing was not in English was a disgrace. I think it was $150 per night, which in my mind came out to be $200 with breakfast, internet, blah blah blah - too expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Not a lot to expect”
Reviews.Author: odontex
Reviews.Content: Once you have stayed at a Novotel, you know how all the rooms are. They are very comfortable, 100% soundproof, big enough and a nice bed. The only thinh I would definetely improve is the shower. The system they use does not give enough water pressure and it is difficult to calculate the temperature. The hotel lobby is quite nice. The pool is excellent and the gym is good enough (above average) for cardio and abs excercises. Here is the problem...... 1. Valet Parking. It can take up to 10 minutes to get your car 2. Restaurant Service. The french influence is obvious in the Menu. Although food is good and size portions are fine, a lot more training is needed for their cooking staff, specially during breakfast time. They are not used to the way american people may ask for their fried eggs (e.g. easy -over). In Mexico there is no such thing as an easy-over fried egg. Cooks in hotel should be taught all these things. Because it is a buffet, waiters are just looking to take away your dirty plates or bring you some more coffee, but if you ask for something else, they would answer very politely that you can get it from the buffet bar. That is not a good gastronomic service, not here not every where. Besides that it is a good business hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Management Problems”
Reviews.Author: Stendec
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Santa Fe has a nice lobby, and the room accomodatons are on a par with other Novotels. However it is the service and management of this hotel that makes it a place to avoid. I have stated there a total of 5 times (business trips) due to the fact that it is the lower cost option. Each and every one of those times was marked by some kind of disappointment and service failure. The most memorable were the following: the time the restaurant below the hotel (Fishers) threw an all night party with loud music until 2:30 am on a Thursday night, or the time the hotel allowed a high school baseball team stay, and did not intervene when the kids were running down the hall and knocking on doors and calling every room. (Again, at 2 am in the morning). The last time I was there, apparently due to cost cutbacks, they did not subscribe to BBC anymore as they had before, and CNN was on the fritz, and it took them over a week to fix, while at first denying a problem existed with the channel. That was the only other English channel available. (I speak Spanish, but it is nice to decompress with some English) When you ask for a wake-up call, it is a 50/50 chance you will get one. The counter personnel are so poorly trained (and slow) it is likely you will be standing for 20-30 minutes when you check out if there is more than one person in front of you. These are fairly minor gripes, but for an international hotel, and the price paid, the service is not acceptable.
